title: Foster mom tied girl, 3, in sheets to stop her moving then let her die of thirst
text:
Sherrie Dirk has admitted murdering a foster toddler in her care by wrapping the youngster in sheets then leaving her to die of dehydration. Her husband Bryce, right, admitted the same crime at an earlier hearing (Pictures: Hennepin County Sheriff’s Office)

A foster mother bound a three year-old girl in her care with sheets so tightly the child couldn’t move, then left her to die of thirst.

Sherrie Dirk admitted murdering the youngster at a court hearing on Friday, after the girl suffered a horrendous death at her home in Minneapolis, Minnesota, in November 2017.

Dirk, 34, pleaded guilty to second-degree murder after the court was told how she ‘completely immobilized’ the girl, who has not been named, by binding her tightly with three sheets.

The killer then left the little girl alone in a room with its door shut.

Dirk’s victim succumbed to hunger and thirst soon afterwards.

She was found unresponsive by her foster father Bryce Dirk, 32, around five hours later with a single sheet around her neck.

Investigators said the toddler’s weight had slumped dramatically since arriving at the Kirk’s home in September 2016.

Bryce Dirk, who is married to Sherrie, admitted second-degree murder last month for turning a blind eye to the little girl’s suffering.

He will be sentenced on November 4, and is expected to receive around 12 and a half years behind bars.

Sherrie Dirk will be sentenced on December 3, and faces up to 25 years in jail for killing the child in her care.

Aggravating factors include the way in which the girl was killed, and the victim’s vulnerable background.

The Dirks’ four other children were removed from their custody after the toddler’s death, with a petition to terminate their parental rights set to be heard next month.
description: Sherrie Dirk has admitted murdering the little girl, and is set to be jailed for up to 25 years when she is sentenced in December
